ðŸ’¡ sui | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a personalized and organized dashboard for servers or as a browser's new tab page.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Customizable startpage/new tab page â€¢ Application and bookmark organization â€¢ Theming options â€¢ Docker deployment â€¢ Git pull variant for automatic updates
ðŸ“– Summary: SUI is a customizable startpage and new tab page designed for servers and personal use. It allows users to easily organize applications and bookmarks, with options for theming and deployment via Docker.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ pause-windows-updates | Batchfile
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide users with granular control over Windows updates, system privacy, and bloatware, allowing for a customized and more secure Windows environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Pause/Disable/Enable Windows Updates â€¢ Remove Windows Telemetry and Tracking â€¢ Debloat Windows Apps and Services â€¢ Apply various Registry Tweaks â€¢ Remove Privacy Threats (Copilot, Recall, Cortana)
ðŸ“– Summary: The Windows Personalization Utility (WPU) is a batch and registry script tool designed to give users control over Windows updates and system privacy. It allows for pausing updates indefinitely, removing telemetry, debloating apps and services, and applying various system tweaks for a more personalized Windows experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ public-ip-address | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To programmatically obtain a client's public IP address and its geographical location within a Rust application.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Retrieve public IP address from multiple services â€¢ Fetch geolocation data â€¢ Asynchronous and blocking interfaces â€¢ Caching functionality with optional encryption â€¢ Support for arbitrary IP address lookup and API keys
ðŸ“– Summary: This Rust crate, `public-ip-address`, provides a straightforward way to retrieve a user's public IP address and associated geolocation data. It supports multiple lookup services, offers both asynchronous and blocking interfaces, and includes optional caching with encryption for privacy and performance.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ warpnet | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a censorship-resistant and decentralized alternative to traditional social media platforms like Twitter.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Decentralized, peer-to-peer architecture â€¢ No central servers required â€¢ Noise protocol for inter-node communication â€¢ Built-in local storage â€¢ Censorship-resistant
ðŸ“– Summary: WarpNet is a decentralized, peer-to-peer social network built with Go, inspired by Twitter. It operates without central servers, utilizing the Noise protocol for secure communication and local storage for data persistence. This design makes WarpNet censorship-resistant, scalable, and fully open-source.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ runtime-radar | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring and responding to runtime security threats in containerized environments.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Flexible monitoring configuration of runtime events via web interface â€¢ Centralized management for multi-cluster installations â€¢ Integration with syslog, SMTP, and webhook â€¢ Develop custom detectors (signatures) in Go using an SDK
ðŸ“– Summary: Runtime Radar is an open-source solution for monitoring runtime security events and responding to incidents within containerized environments. It offers flexible configuration, centralized multi-cluster management, and integration with existing security systems, providing accessible protection and user-friendly tools.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ flint | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Simplifying and streamlining the management of KVM virtual machines through a user-friendly interface and a streamlined, bloat-free tool.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Single binary distribution (<11MB) â€¢ Modern Web UI, CLI, and API â€¢ No XML configuration required â€¢ Supports KVM/QEMU â€¢ Provides binaries for glibc and musl (Alpine Linux)
ðŸ“– Summary: Flint is a lightweight, self-contained KVM management tool that provides a modern Web UI, CLI, and API for managing virtual machines. It aims for zero bloat and maximum efficiency, simplifying VM management without relying on complex XML configurations.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
